name: Flood Control Dam Timing
description: Testing dam water level changes and timing mechanics using working debug commands

entries.expectedOutput:
Dam
You are standing on the top of the Flood Control Dam #3, which was quite a tourist attraction in times far distant. There are paths to the north, south, and west, and a scramble down.

There is a control panel here, on which a large metal bolt is mounted. Directly above the bolt is a small sign.
entries.notes: At the dam with control panel visible

entries.expectedOutput:
The sign reads: "Emergency Flood Control

Flood Control System... Maintenance Only"
The sluice gates open and water pours through the dam.
entries.notes: Opening the dam gates - this triggers water level changes

entries.expectedOutput:
Dam Lobby
This room appears to have been the waiting room for groups touring the dam. There are open doorways here to the north and east marked "Private", and there is a path leading south over the top of the dam.
entries.notes: Going down to dam lobby - water level affects accessibility

entries.expectedOutput:
Maintenance Room
This is what appears to have been the maintenance room for Flood Control Dam #3. Apparently, this room has been ransacked recently, for most of the valuable equipment is gone. On the wall in front of you is a group of buttons, which are labeled in EBCDIC. However, they are of different colors: Blue, Yellow, Brown, and Red.
entries.notes: Exploring maintenance area now accessible due to water level
More time passing - water continues draining

entries.expectedOutput:
Dam Lobby
This room appears to have been the waiting room for groups touring the dam. There are open doorways here to the north and east marked "Private", and there is a path leading south over the top of the dam.

Deep Canyon
You are on the south edge of a deep canyon. Passages lead off to the east, northwest and southwest. A stairway leads down.
entries.notes: Water level changes affect room accessibility

entries.expectedOutput:
Reservoir South
You are in a long room on the south shore of a large lake, far too deep and wide for crossing.

There is a trunk here, bulging with jewels.
entries.notes: Water level low enough to access reservoir and treasure
